content.definition: A contrast-based imaging study of a hemodialysis arteriovenous fistula or graft that visualizes the arterial inflow, anastomosis, body of the fistula/graft, venous outflow, and central veins. Fistulograms are both diagnostic and therapeutic, commonly combined with interventions such as angioplasty or thrombectomy.

diagnostic: Access dysfunction (elevated venous pressures, poor flow)

access: Antegrade puncture into fistula/graft body (most common)
Brachial or femoral approach for central evaluation

complications: Vessel rupture (treat with prolonged balloon, covered stent)
